Computer_Science_tweet_71_p$Computer_Sci.text:
Finding A: We have demonstrated the feasibility of adaptive DBS in PD using a fully implantable device, with feedback control provided by a cortical gamma band oscillation related to the emergence of dyskinesia, a common adverse effect of levodopa therapy and of STN DBS.
Finding B: This suggests an exciting opportunity for the role of immersive virtual environments in assisting in recall.
Finding C: The results consistently showed that people will take a utilitarian approach to the ethics of autonomous vehicles, one emphasizing the sheer number of lives that could be saved.
Finding D: "Not surprisingly, millennials and younger professionals were more likely to be accepting of smartphone use, but they might be doing themselves a disservice," Cardon said.

Computer_Science_36_p$Computer_Science_4.text:
Finding A: showed that children observing physical towers in a mixed-reality game learned physics principles better and showed higher levels of enjoyment compared to students interacting with a solely virtual game on a laptop .
Finding B: One might expect the many factors absent from the urban explorer process -variations in street segment lengths and driving speeds, taxi-taxi interactions, human routing decisions, heterogeneities in passenger pickup and dropoff times and locations -would play a role in the statistical properties of real taxis.
Finding C: The 3D printed prostate model demonstrated high fidelity with patient organ and tissue in ana tomical, static and dynamic mechanical, hardness, and optical properties.
Finding D: Dramatic age gap: Younger professionals were nearly three times as likely as older professionals to think tapping out a message over a business lunch is appropriate -- 66 percent of people under 30 said texting or emailing was okay, compared to just 20 percent of those aged 51-65.

Computer_Science_400_r$Computer_Science_.text:
Finding A: The team writes: "The researchers found a significant increase in anxiety, heart rate and blood pressure levels, and a significant decrease in puzzle performance when the participants were separated from their iPhones as compared to when iPhone users completed similar word search puzzles while in possession of their iPhones."
Finding B: At the aggregate level we find that the airlines that began charging for one checked bag saw a significant relative improvement in their on-time departure performance in the 35-day period afterwards, compared to the airlines that were not charging for a checked bag during the same time period.
Finding C: Further, both the anticipation of the leisure activity and enjoyment from it decreased once it was scheduled.
Finding D: "This leads to the possibility that a spatial virtual memory palace -- experienced in an immersive virtual environment -- could enhance learning and recall by leveraging a person\'s overall sense of body position, movement and acceleration," Plaisant says.
Computer_Science_400_r$Computer_Science_.displayed_text:
Finding A: The team writes: "The researchers found a significant increase in anxiety, heart rate and blood pressure levels, and a significant decrease in puzzle performance when the participants were separated from their iPhones as compared to when iPhone users completed similar word search puzzles while in possession of their iPhones."
Finding B: At the aggregate level we find that the airlines that began charging for one checked bag saw a significant relative improvement in their on-time departure performance in the 35-day period afterwards, compared to the airlines that were not charging for a checked bag during the same time period.
Finding C: Further, both the anticipation of the leisure activity and enjoyment from it decreased once it was scheduled.
Finding D: "This leads to the possibility that a spatial virtual memory palace -- experienced in an immersive virtual environment -- could enhance learning and recall by leveraging a person\'s overall sense of body position, movement and acceleration," Plaisant says.

Computer_Science_108_r$Computer_Science_.text:
Finding A: The findings, published in the journal Management Science, shows airlines improved their median departure time between 3.3 to 4.2 minutes and reduced average departure delays between 1.3 to 2 minutes, depending on whether they charged for the first or second checked bag.
Finding B: In both patients there were energy savings without worsening of clinical symptoms.
Finding C: Thus, Poincaré [41] suggested that spatial knowledge emerges from the agent\'s capacity to move, with spatial relations such as the distance to an object being internally encoded as potential motor commands.
Finding D: The differences between women and men were quite striking, with men nearly twice as likely to consider various mobile phone behaviors as acceptable in informal meetings.
Computer_Science_108_r$Computer_Science_.displayed_text:
Finding A: The findings, published in the journal Management Science, shows airlines improved their median departure time between 3.3 to 4.2 minutes and reduced average departure delays between 1.3 to 2 minutes, depending on whether they charged for the first or second checked bag.
Finding B: In both patients there were energy savings without worsening of clinical symptoms.
Finding C: Thus, Poincaré [41] suggested that spatial knowledge emerges from the agent\'s capacity to move, with spatial relations such as the distance to an object being internally encoded as potential motor commands.
Finding D: The differences between women and men were quite striking, with men nearly twice as likely to consider various mobile phone behaviors as acceptable in informal meetings.

Computer_Science_tweet_13_r$Computer_Sci.text:
Finding A: Research proves that Virtual Palaces in VR actually helps in remembering stuff better via @username #VirtualReality #VR #education
Finding B: Because women tend to use Facebook more than men, they may take interactions more seriously, explaining why women in the study reported higher Facebook jealousy.
Finding C: 'Physical observation + interactive feedback improved children’s learning by 5x' via Nesra Yannier @username
Finding D: We used this information to focus restaurant inspections in two cities and demonstrated that FINDER improves the accuracy of health inspections; restaurants identified by FINDER are 3.1 times as likely to be deemed unsafe during the inspection as restaurants identified by existing methods.

Finding A: Research proves that Virtual Palaces in VR actually helps in remembering stuff better via @username #VirtualReality #VR #education
Finding B: Because women tend to use Facebook more than men, they may take interactions more seriously, explaining why women in the study reported higher Facebook jealousy.

Finding D: We used this information to focus restaurant inspections in two cities and demonstrated that FINDER improves the accuracy of health inspections; restaurants identified by FINDER are 3.1 times as likely to be deemed unsafe during the inspection as restaurants identified by existing methods.

Computer_Science_358_r$Computer_Science_.text:
Finding A: And MRIs showed that the successful trainees\' hippocampi had grown over time.
Finding B: If memory recall could be enhanced through immersively experiencing the environment in which the information was learned, it would suggest that virtual environments could serve as a valuable tool for various facets of retrospective cognizance, including retention and recall.
Finding C: These results provide strong convergent and discriminant validity for the potential that playing an immoral character in a video game leads to an increased salience of content-relevant intuitions mediated by the moral emotion of guilt.
Finding D: With respect to the four challenges posed at the outset, clear evidence emerged for individual variation in a core language skill at each of 11 ages, for convergence of multiple indices of language at each age on latent variables representing a core language skill, for the homotypic and heterotypic stability of core language skill over the long term, and for the robustness of long-term stability of core language skill in atypically developing children with several different types of health risk.
